title: Treat Heat Stroke Emergency
brief: Treat life-threatening heat stroke - patient will die if not cooled immediately.
steps: Step 1: Recognize symptoms - no sweating, hot dry skin, headache, dizziness, fast pulse, nausea, vomiting, mental confusion leading to unconsciousness.
Step 2: Immediately move patient to shade.
Step 3: Place patient on stretcher or platform 45 centimeters off ground.
Step 5: Pour water on patient (any water, even polluted or brackish).
Step 6: Fan patient vigorously while pouring water.
Step 7: Massage arms, legs, and body to improve circulation.
Step 8: If patient regains consciousness, give small amounts of water every 3 minutes.
warnings: This is a life-threatening emergency - patient may die without immediate cooling.
Use any available water, even if contaminated.
Continue cooling until body temperature drops and sweating resumes.
